intro: Cordylanthus pilosus subsp. tirfidus, commonly known as the Sierra foothill bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of the region. It produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
